6 〔ひきあう〕 pay. [＝ひきあう 1]
►内職は時間ばかりかかって賃金が少なく, 割に合わないといってパートに出る奥さんが多い.　A lot of housewives take on part-time jobs outside the home, ┏saying that they can't make a profit from time-consuming, low-wage domestic piecework [arguing that badly paid domestic piecework takes too much time and doesn't pay].
・3 人兄弟の真ん中って, いつも上や下に無視されるか利用されるかで, 割に合わないんだよな.　If you are the middle of three brothers you are always either ignored or exploited from above and below. It's unfair, isn't it? [It's not fair, is it? ｜ It's unjust, isn't it?]
・それは 1,000 円で売っては合わない.　It wouldn't pay to sell it for 1,000 yen.
・働きすぎで体をこわしたら合わないでしょ.　It's ┏self-defeating [false economy] to work so hard that you make yourself ill. ｜ In the long run you'll be no better off if you work so hard that you get ill.
・「そんなことをしていては合わないだろう」とよく忠告されるが, 私は, 貧しい人には, ある時払いで治療している.　People often warn me that I can't expect to balance the books that way, but I treat poor people on a "pay-when-you-can" basis.

・自分も一緒に会社をおこしたのに, 彼ばかり有名になって, 何か合わない感じがする.　I feel it is somehow ┏unfair [unreasonable] that although it was both of us who set up the company he gets all the fame. ｜ I established the company with him, so I feel there is something disproportionate in him getting all the fame.

あう２【会う・逢う・遭う】 [ローマ字](au)
1 〔約束して対面する・面談する〕 see sb; meet sb; have an appointment 《with sb》.

・君とは初めて会った気がしない.　It doesn't feel as if this is ┏the first time I've met you [the first time we've met, the first time we've seen each other].
2 〔偶然出会う〕 meet sb 《by chance》; 《口》 bump into sb; come ┏across [on, upon] sb [sth]; 《文》 encounter ┏sb [sth]; *《口》 light ┏on [upon] sb [sth].

・ずっと会っていなかった小学校の級友に大都会の真ん中で会えるとは思ってもいなかった.　It never crossed my mind that I ┏might [would, could] meet [come across, 《口》 bump into] a classmate from my primary school whom I had not seen for many years, right in the middle of the city.

3 〔好ましくない事態に遭遇する〕 have 《an accident, a crash》; be [get] involved in 《an accident, a fight》; be in 《an earthquake, a war》; suffer [undergo] 《pain, an unpleasant experience》; go through 《a bad experience》; be [get] 《badly treated, punished, etc.》; have [get] 《sth stolen》; be [get] caught 《in a storm, in a civil war》; face [be confronted by] 《a crisis》.

・こわい目にあう　have a ┏frightening [terrifying] experience

・すりにあう　have [get] one's pocket picked

►(電車で)痴漢にあった.　She ┏was [got] molested [《俗》 felt up] (on the train). ｜ I [She] was [got] ┏felt up [groped] (on the train).
・船は嵐にあって沈んでしまった.　The ship ┏was caught in a storm and sank [went down in a storm].

あわせる１【合わせる】 [ローマ字](awaseru)
1 〔1 つにする〕 bring together; unite; combine; connect; 〔併合する〕 amalgamate; merge; annex.
►3 室を合わせて一室に改造する　convert three rooms into one
・各派を合わせて一党とする　combine the factions into a party
・柔道とボクシングを合わせた手を使う　use a technique that combines judo and boxing.
►彼は, 軍人とスポーツマンと探検家を合わせて一つにしたような男だ.　He's like a soldier, an athlete, and an explorer all rolled into one.
・彼らは心を合わせて働いた.　They worked together in perfect accord.
・二人で力を合わせて幸せな家庭を築いていきます.　We will ┏work together to build [join in building] a happy family.
2 〔くっつける〕 put together; join.
►手を合わせる　join one's hands; put [place] one's hands together
・彼女は祈るように胸の前で手を合わせた.　She joined her hands before her breast, as if in prayer.
・頭の上で両手を合わせて, 静かに息を吐いてください.　Join your hands above your head and breathe out ┏gently [quietly].
・親指と人差し指を合わせる　put [hold] one's thumb and forefinger together
・(自分の)膝を合わせる　put one's knees together
・えりを合わせる　adjust one's ┏neckline [collar]
・(和服の)えりを深めに合わせて着る　wear a kimono with the neckbands crossed high under the throat.
3 〔合計する〕 put together; add (up).
►3 と 5 を合わせる　add three and five.
►君たち 2 人を合わせたよりも重い.　I am heavier than both of you (put) together.
・日本の人口はイギリスとフランスを合わせたより多い.　Japan's population is larger than that of Britain and France combined.
・3 学部合わせて学生在籍数 1 万を有する.　The three departments have a combined enrollment of 10,000 students.
・すべてを合わせると, 装備の重量は 12 キロを超える.　When you put it all together, the equipment weighs ┏over [more than] twelve kilograms.
・みんなの年を合わせると 120 歳になった.　Their combined ages came to 120.
・全員の金を合わせても, たった 1,500 円だった.　We had only 1,500 yen ┏between [among] us.
4 〔調合する〕 mix; compound.
►薬を合わせる　compound [prepare] a medicine
・調味料を合わせる　mix seasonings (together).
5 〔適合させる・一致させる〕 set [fit, suit, adjust, adapt, conform, gear] 《one thing to another》; tune [tailor] 《sth to the purpose》; bring sth into line 《with another》; 〔配合する〕 match 《colors》.
►時計を合わせる　correct one's watch; set a clock right 《by a correct one》; 〔複数の時計を同一時刻にする〕 set watches together; synchronize watches
・時計をテレビの時報に合わせる　set [adjust] one's watch by the TV time signal
・戦闘機のパイロットたちは発進する前に時計を合わせた.　The fighter pilots ┏set their watches together [synchronized their watches] before taking off.
・目覚まし時計を朝 6 時に合わせる　set the alarm clock for 6:00 a.m.
・ラジオを NHK に合わせてごらん. 天気予報をやっているから.　Tune in to the NHK station; the weather report's on now.
・お気に入りの連続ドラマを見ようと彼女はテレビを 8 チャンネルに合わせた.　She switched to Channel 8 in order to watch her favorite ┏drama series [serial drama].
・ピントを合わせる　focus 《one's camera on sth》
・沖を行く船に望遠鏡を合わせた.　I focused the telescope on a ship out at sea.
・靴を足に合わせて作る　make shoes to measure; make shoes to fit the feet
・見本に寸法を合わせて作る　make sth to the same measurements as a sample
・縮尺に合わせて地図を描く　draw a map to scale
・ピアノに合わせて踊る[歌う]　dance [sing] ┏to (a) piano accompaniment [to the accompaniment of a piano]
・音楽に合わせて手を叩く　clap one's hands in time to the music
・船頭は歌に合わせて漕いだ.　The boatman rowed ┏in time with his song [to the accompaniment of a song].
・泳ぐときに手足の動きを合わせる　coordinate the movements of 《their》 arms and legs when they swim
・歩調を合わせる　keep in step 《with ┏sb [sth]》
・本音を隠して彼に話を合わせた.　Not ┏giving away [revealing] what I really thought, I went along with what he said.
・彼女から問い合わせが来ると思ったので, あらかじめ彼と話を合わせておいた.　I figured she would question me, so I worked out with him ahead of time what we would say.
・呼吸を合わせる　work in smooth harmony 《with sb》; harmonize one's actions with those of another
・投手と野手が呼吸を合わせないと盗塁は防げない.　If the pitcher and fielders don't ┏work together smoothly [coordinate their actions], they can't prevent base stealing.
・作業員たちはみんなで口裏を合わせて, 事故の原因に関する事実を隠していた.　The workers agreed on ┏a single version of events [what they would say] and ┏hid [concealed] the truth regarding the cause of the accident.
・ハイキングでは脚の弱い人のペースに合わせることが必要だ.　In hiking it is necessary to adjust to the ┏slowest walker's [slow walkers'] pace.
・結婚当初は彼の生活ペースに合わせるのが大変だった.　In the beginning of our married life I found it hard to adjust to the pace of my husband's life.
・この子は他の子供とうまく合わせてゆくことができない.　This child cannot fit in with other children.
・地域の実状に合わせて活動を進める　go ahead with programs in a way that suits the situation in a particular region; gear one's activities to the realities of a region
・予算に合わせて選ぶ　choose ┏within [in accordance with] the budget
・予算に合わせてお好きなドレスが選べます.　You can choose a dress of your choice to suit your budget.
・毎年予算に合わせて購入図書を選んでいる.　Every year we stick within the parameters of our budget when selecting the books we purchase.
・客の好みに合わせて味付けを変える　change the seasoning to suit the preferences of the customers
・時間はそちらの都合に合わせます.　You name the time. ｜ You name a time that suits you.
・どの年齢層の視聴者に照準を合わせるのかが問題だ.　The problem is deciding which ┏viewer [audience] age group to aim at.
6 〔照合する〕 compare; check (up) 《with…》; tally 《with…》.
►訳文を原文と合わせる　compare the translation with the original
・答えを合わせる　check the answers.

8 〔合奏する〕 play different musical instruments in concert.
►二人は琴に尺八を合わせた.　They played a duet with a koto and a shakuhachi.

あわせる２【会わせる・遭わせる】 [ローマ字](awaseru)

►(間に入って)二人を会わせてやる　arrange a meeting between two persons.

・私はその親子を会わせてやった.　I brought the ┏father [mother] and ┏son [daughter] together.
・彼女に会わせてほしい.　I'm asking you to let me meet her. ｜ I'd like you to arrange for me to meet her.
・会わせる顔がない.　I'm too ashamed to meet ┏him [her, the person, them].
2 〔経験・事物に〕 expose 《sb to…》; subject 《sb to…》.
►危ない目にあわせる　expose sb to danger
・痛い目にあわせる　subject sb to pain; make sb suffer; 〔比喩的に〕 make sb pay for sth; teach sb a painful lesson
・あいつ, 今度妹に近づいたら痛い目にあわせてやる.　The next time he approaches my (younger) sister, I'll ┏teach him a painful lesson [make him pay for it].
・本人のためにも一度痛い目にあわせておいたほうがいい.　It'd be to the person's own benefit, too, if we taught ┏him [her] an early painful lesson.

あわただしく　hurriedly; hastily; in a flurry; in a hurry; in ┏great [feverish] haste; in a tearing rush; hurry-scurry.

〔落ち着きを失う〕 be ┏confused [flurried, flustered]; get rattled; be disconcerted; lose one's ┏head [composure, cool]; lose one's ┏self-possession [presence of mind]; get scared; panic; take alarm; 〔ひどく急ぐ〕 be hurried; be in a hurry; be in a big rush; be hasty. [⇒ろうばい２]

►怪しげに　dubiously; doubtingly; suspiciously.
►怪しげな雲行きだ. ひと雨来るかもしれない.　The weather looks doubtful. It might rain for a while. ｜ It's uncertain weather. There might be a spot of rain.
・隣に画家を自称する怪しげな老人が住んでいる.　There's a mysterious old man living next door to us who claims to be a painter.
・あの家には毎日怪しげな連中が集まってくる.　A ┏strange [suspicious] group of people gather at that house every day.
・怪しげな企業には就職したくない.　I don't want to get a job in some ┏dubious [shady] company. ｜ I wouldn't like to work for some fly-by-night business.
・電話番をするだけで 1 日 5 万円くれるなんて, 怪しげな話だな.　Fifty thousand a day for just sitting by the phone? There's something fishy about that. ｜ They say they'll give you 50,000 yen a day just for watching the phone? That sounds suspicious (to me).

あやしい【怪しい】 [ローマ字](ayashii)
1 【怪しい・妖しい】 〔不思議な・神秘的な・引きつける力をもつ〕 strange; mysterious; enticing; alluring.
►彼の声には怪しい魅力がある.　There is a mysterious attractiveness to his voice. ｜ His voice has an undefinable allure to it.
・彼女の胸元で宝石があやしく光っていた.　The jewel at her breast glittered alluringly.
2 〔不気味な・気味の悪い〕 strange; weird; uncanny; eerie; spooky.
►窓の外で怪しい物音がした.　There was a ┏strange [weird] noise outside the window.
・夜中に人間のものとは思われないような怪しい呻(うめ)き声が地下室から聞こえた.　In the middle of the night we heard moans coming from the basement that didn't sound like human moans.
3 〔不審な〕 strange; suspicious; dubious; questionable; sinister; shady; fishy. [⇒あやしげ]
►怪しいと思う　suspect; regard as suspicious. [⇒あやしむ]
►事件現場で怪しい男女が見かけられた.　A suspicious couple was seen at the scene of the incident.
・あいつはどうもそぶりが怪しい.　There's something suspicious about him. ｜ That guy just has a shady look about him.
・私は別に怪しい人間[者]ではありません.　There's nothing suspicious about me, really.
・怪しい奴はだれだ.　Who is ┏guilty [the guilty party]?
・〔嫌疑をかけて〕 あいつが怪しい.　I suspect him (to be guilty). ｜ He's the one I suspect.
・国籍不明の怪しい飛行機が領空を通過していった.　A mysterious airplane (of unknown nationality) flew across our airspace.
4 〔男女の関係〕 dubious (in sexual relations).
►あの二人は最近怪しい.　There's something going on between those two these days.
・彼と彼女は怪しい関係らしいよ.　There seems to be some sort of (amorous [intimate]) relationship between him and her.
・君は田中さんと怪しいんじゃないのか.　Isn't there something (happening) between you and Tanaka? ｜ Haven't you and Tanaka got something going?
5 〔不安を感じさせるような〕 uncertain; ominous; dangerous(-looking).
►雲行きが怪しいから傘を持っていこう.　The weather looks uncertain, so I'll take my umbrella.
・勝利は間違いないと思っていたのに, なんだか怪しい試合展開になってきた.　I thought we were bound to win, but now the game is going badly for us.
6 〔あぶなっかしい・信用できない〕 unsure; uncertain; untrustworthy; dangerous.
►君の包丁を持つ手つきは怪しいね.　I don't trust the way you hold the (kitchen) knife.
・彼の英語は怪しいものだよ.　His English is not to be trusted. ｜ He speaks broken English.
・その話は少し怪しいんじゃないか.　Isn't that a sort of dubious story? ｜ Doesn't that sound rather fishy?
・あの会社は経営状態が怪しいよ.　That company is in a dangerous (financial) situation. ｜ That company's having problems.
・彼が成功するかどうか怪しいものだ.　It is unlikely that he will succeed. ｜ His success is doubtful. ｜ I have some doubts about his success.

あやしむ【怪しむ】 [ローマ字](ayashimu)
〔いぶかる〕 doubt; question; be doubtful 《of…》; be dubious 《of…》; be skeptical 《about [of]…》; have doubts 《about [as to]…》; wonder 《about [as to]…, whether…》 [⇒うたがう]; 〔変だと思う〕 suspect; be suspicious 《of…》; feel suspicion 《about…》; entertain suspicion; attach suspicion 《to…》; be suspicious 《about…, of…》; 〔どこかうさんくさいと思う〕 《口》 smell a rat. [⇒けんぎ３]
►本当かしらと怪しむ　wonder if it can be true
・怪しむに足りない　be not to be ┏wondered [surprised] at; be quite natural; it is not surprising that…; it is no wonder that…; I would not be surprised if…; there is nothing strange in…
・その事件で大衆が激怒したのも怪しむに足りない.　There was a great public outcry at the incident, and no wonder.
・怪しまれる　be suspected; incur [excite] suspicion; come [fall] under suspicion
・怪しまれずに　unsuspected(ly).
►彼は人を信じて怪しまない男だ.　He is a very trusting person (who never doubts other people).
・企業から大金を受け取って怪しまない政治家がいる.　There are some politicians who think there's nothing improper even when they receive huge sums of money from enterprises.
・人々は彼の挙動を怪しんだ.　People were suspicious of his actions. ｜ His behavior gave rise to suspicion among those around him.
・君は怪しまれても仕方がない.　It's hardly surprising that you're under suspicion. ｜ You are ┏open [liable] to suspicion.
・そんなことをすると怪しまれる.　If you do that, it will ┏excite [arouse] suspicion.
・彼は人に怪しまれるような人間ではない.　He is not the sort of person to arouse suspicion. ｜ His character is above suspicion.
・怪しまれないように表口から堂々と帰りなさい.　To avoid (being regarded with) suspicion, leave openly by the front door.

あやす [ローマ字](ayasu)
fondle; dandle; nurse; 〔泣いている赤ん坊を〕 pacify; humor; try to please 《a baby》; play with 《a baby》.
►赤ん坊を抱いてあやす　pacify a baby by holding it in one's arms; cradle a baby in one's arms
・赤ん坊をあやして笑わせる　make a baby ┏smile [laugh] by ┏bouncing it up and down [playing peekaboo with it]; coax a baby to smile.
►友人は私をあやすようになだめた.　My friend tried to soothe me as if I was a baby.

あやつりにんぎょう【操り人形】 [ローマ字](ayatsuriningyō)
1 〔文楽の人形〕 a (Bunraku) puppet; 〔糸遣いの人形〕 a marionette; 〔棒遣いの人形〕 a puppet; 〔指人形〕 a ┏glove [hand, finger] puppet.
►操り人形のように　like a puppet (on a string); as if (being manipulated) on ┏strings [wires].
►操り人形を操る　work [manipulate] a puppet.
2 〔他人に操られる人〕 a puppet 《of big business, etc.》; a person being manipulated by somebody else; a yes-man.
►あの部長は社長の操り人形だ.　Our department head is the president's ┏puppet [yes-man].
・親の操り人形にはなりたくない.　I don't want to be ┏controlled [kept on a string] by my parents.
◧操り人形芝居　〔棒・手遣いの〕 a puppet ┏show [play]; 〔糸遣いの〕 a marionette show.

あやつりしばい【操り芝居】 [ローマ字](ayatsurishibai)

あやつる【操る】 [ローマ字](ayatsuru)
〔人形を〕 work [manipulate, operate] 《a puppet》; 〔操作する〕 handle; manage; manipulate; operate 《a machine, a device, a system》; pull 《an oar》; steer 《a ship》; ply 《a tool》; 〔背後で糸を引く〕 pull (the) wires; pull strings; mastermind 《a plot》; stage-manage 《a committee》.
►巧みに操る　manipulate 《the market》 (skillfully); maneuver 《an airplane》 (adroitly)
・馬を巧みに操る　control [rein] a horse well
・人形は巧みに糸で操られていた.　The puppets were being ┏moved [worked] skillfully on their strings.
・自在に操る　manipulate [operate] sth ┏freely [at will]
・ボールを自在に操る　handle [control] a ball easily
・楽器を操る　handle a musical instrument
・聴衆を操る　manipulate [control, handle] an audience; play on an audience; have an audience in the palm of one's hands
・世論を操る　manipulate public opinion
・物価を操る　rig [fix] prices
・人を思いのままに操る　make a puppet of sb; have [keep] sb on a string; have [keep] sb under one's thumb; twist [turn] sb round one's (little) finger; have sb in the palm of one's hand; have sb (completely) under one's control
・英語を自由に操る　speak English ┏well [fluently]; have a good command of English
・あの人は 5, 6 か国語を自由に操る.　He has a fluent command of half a dozen foreign languages.
・委員会を操っている　be in control of [stage-manage] a committee
・いいように操られる　be made a puppet of; be kept on a string; be under sb's thumb; be at sb's beck and call
・男[女]に操られる　be under the ┏control [thumb] of a ┏man [woman]; be in the palm of a ┏man's [woman's] hand
・彼があのように遺言したのは, 愛人に操られていたからだ.　He made such a will because his mistress had him under her thumb.
・子分をうまく操っている.　He has his followers well ┏in hand [under his thumb].
・あそこの社員は完全に社長に操られている.　The employees at that company are completely ┏under the president's thumb [in the palm of the president's hand].
・今度のクーデターはあの男が背後で操っていたのだ.　He was the man pulling the strings behind the scenes in the latest coup d'état.
・あいつは人に操られやすいところがある.　In some ways he's a person who is easy to control. ｜ You can easily twist him round your little finger.

あやうい【危うい】 [ローマ字](ayaui)
＝あぶない.
►社内の力関係は危うい均衡を保っていた.　A ┏delicate [perilous] balance of power was being maintained in the company.
・現在の財政状況ではこの町の将来は危うい.　Under its present financial circumstances, the future of the town is at risk.
・君子(は)危うきに近寄らず.　A wise man keeps out of ┏danger [harm's way]. ｜ Fools rush in where angels fear to tread. 【諺】
危うくする endanger; imperil; compromise; jeopardize.
►人の地位を危うくしようとする　try to undermine sb's position
・自分の愚行で地位[名声, 信望]を危うくする　compromise one's ┏position [reputation, credit] by one's own folly
・国家を危うくする　compromise the safety of the country.

あやうく【危うく】 [ローマ字](ayauku)
〔かろうじて〕 barely; narrowly; 〔まかりまちがえば〕 almost; nearly; (only) just in time; by the skin of one's teeth. [＝あぶなく]
►危うく免れる　barely escape; make a narrow escape; escape by the skin of one's teeth
・危うく死から逃れる　barely escape death; narrowly escape with one's life; be snatched from the jaws of death
・危うくセーフになる　narrowly make it safe
・三塁走者は本塁にすべり込み, 危うくセーフだった.　The third-base runner slid into home and narrowly ┏beat the tag [made it safe].
・「今朝は学校に遅刻しなかった?」「始業 2 分前に着いて危うくセーフだったよ」　"Weren't you late to school this morning?"―"Just made it, with two minutes to spare."
・危うく遅刻するところだった.　I was almost (too) late. ｜ I barely made it (in time).

あゆかけばり【鮎掛け鉤】 [ローマ字](ayukakebari)

あゆみ【歩み】 [ローマ字](ayumi)
1 〔歩くこと〕 walking; stepping; a step; 〔歩調〕 pace.
►牛の歩み　〔おそい歩み〕 plodding like a bull; (a) snail's pace
・羊の歩み　〔死に近づくこと〕 a slow approach to death.
►歩み方　one's ┏gait [walk].
►歩みが速い[遅い]　walk ┏quickly [slowly]; be a ┏quick [slow] walker.
►歩みを速める　quicken one's pace
・歩みをゆるめる　relax [slacken] one's pace
・歩みを止める　stop walking; halt in one's stride.
►警察に呼ばれた彼の歩みは重かった.　Called by the police, he walked with a heavy gait.
2 〔物事の進行〕 progress; 〔過程〕 course; process; 〔沿革〕 development.
►国の歩み　the course of a ┏country [nation]
・順調な歩み　good [favorable, smooth] progress
・着実な歩み　steady [solid, sound] progress.
►その日から彼女のピアニストとしての歩みが始まった.　Her ┏life [career] as a pianist began (on) that day. ｜ It was (on) that day that her ┏life [career] as a pianist began.
►…の歩みをたどる　trace the development of…
・わが社の 50 年の歩みをこの一冊にまとめました.　We have brought together (the) fifty years of this ┏company [company's history] in this book. ｜ The fifty years (of history) of the company have been published in this volume.
・私の少年期は高度経済成長と歩みを共にしていた.　I spent my youth during the time the economy was developing rapidly. ｜ My youth coincided with the economic boom years.
・わが社の黒字転換への歩みを振り返ってみよう.　Let's look back at how the company went into the black. ｜ I would like to review the process by which the company developed a favorable bank balance.
►時代の歩みはそれを生きている人間にはわからぬものである.　The course taken by an age is not perceived by those who live through it.

あゆみより【歩み寄り】 [ローマ字](ayumiyori)
(a) compromise; mutual concessions; (a) rapprochement.
►関係諸国の歩み寄りが求められている.　Compromise by all countries involved is being sought. ｜ A rapprochement is required on the part of all nations involved.
・今後, 双方の一層の歩み寄りが望まれる.　Further mutual rapprochement is to be hoped for.
・ついに両者の歩み寄りが見られた.　Finally, a compromise was reached ┏by [on] both sides.
►双方の歩み寄りで事が円満に解決した.　The matter was settled amicably by ┏mutual concessions [concessions on both sides].
►歩み寄りによって決まった価格　a compromise price; a price reached by compromise.
►歩み寄りの余地がある[ない].　There ┏is [is no] room for compromise.
・われわれにはもう歩み寄りの余地はない.　We no longer have any room ┏for compromise [to make concessions].
・与野党は歩み寄りの姿勢を見せた.　The ┏governing [ruling] and the opposition parties indicated that they were ready to compromise.

あゆみよる【歩み寄る】 [ローマ字](ayumiyoru)

►歩み寄って　by mutual concession
・歩み寄って争いを解決する　solve a quarrel by ┏compromise [compromising]
・少しずつ歩み寄る　inch 《towards a settlement》.
►この交渉では結局双方が歩み寄る形となった.　In these negotiations both sides ended up compromising.

あゆむ【歩む】 [ローマ字](ayumu)

あざ２【痣】 [ローマ字](aza)
a birthmark; (a) skin discoloration; a macula 《pl. -lae, 〜s》; 〔打った跡〕 a bruise; (目のまわりの) a black eye.
►青いあざ　a mole. [⇒あおあざ]

►きのう机の角にぶつけたところがあざになった.　I ┏developed [got] a bruise where I hit myself on the corner of the desk yesterday.

►弟は学校で殴られて目のまわりにあざを作って帰ってきた.　My brother got beaten up at school and came home with a black eye.
►坂を転げ落ちて私は全身あざだらけになった.　I fell down the slope and [After falling down the slope I] was black and blue all over.

あざける【嘲る】 [ローマ字](azakeru)
laugh at…; make fun of…; deride; ridicule; sneer 《at…》; mock; gibe [jibe]; scoff 《at…》; jeer 《at…》; taunt; treat…with scorn; bring…into ridicule; cast ridicule on…; hold…up to ridicule; 《口》 pooh(-pooh).

・ばかなこと[真似(まね)]をする　do a ┏foolish [stupid] thing; act foolishly; commit (a) folly; make an ass of oneself; play [act] the fool
・ばかな真似をするな.　Don't make a fool of yourself.
・ばかなことはやめろ.　Stop making a fool of yourself! ｜ Stop being ridiculous!
►大ばか　a ┏big [stupid, damned, crazy] idiot; a ┏big [blooming, bloody] fool
・コンピューターばか　a computer ┏fan [enthusiast]

►ばかくさい　＝ばからしい
・ばか呼ばわりする　call sb a fool.
►ばかにつける薬は無い.　There is no cure for a fool. ｜ No medicine can cure a fool. ｜ A born fool is never cured.

►ばかの大食い.　A blockhead is always greedy.
・ばかの一つ覚え.　A fool knows only one thing. ｜ A fool repeats the only thing he knows.
►ばかめ!　You ┏fool [idiot, imbecile, moron]!
・ばかだねえ.　〔冗談に〕 You silly fool!
・ばかだなあ, そんなことをして.　What a fool [How silly] to do such a thing!
・ばかと煙は高い所にのぼりたがる.　Fools and smoke seek out ┏the heights [high places].
・そんなことに賛成するばかはいない.　No one is foolish enough to support it.
・彼はそんなことをするようなばかじゃない.　He knows better (than to do such a thing). ｜ He's too smart for that.
・そんなことをするなんてあいつもずいぶんばかだなあ.　It is very silly of him to (go and) do such a thing.
・やつはなんてばかなんだ.　He ought to be smarter than that. ｜ He should have a lot more sense.
・お前はこんなばかじゃないと思っていたが.　I gave you credit for more sense.
・私はばかだった.　It was silly of me.
・彼はなかなかどうしてばかではない.　He is nobody's fool. ｜ He is by no means to be trifled with.
・ばかとはさみは使いよう(で切れる).　Praise a fool, and you may make him useful.
・ばかは死ななきゃ直らない.　He who is born a fool is never cured. 【諺】 ｜ Only death cures a fool.
・ばかほどこわいものはない.　Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
2 〔常識はずれなこと, 筋の通らないこと〕 absurdity; nonsense; 〔無益なこと〕 folly; 〔つまらないこと〕 stupidity.
〜な foolish; silly; absurd; nonsensical; ridiculous; egregious.
►ばかな気を起こすんじゃないぞ.　Don't do anything foolish!
・なんてばかな話だ.　Don't be ridiculous!
・いい年をしてそんなばかなことをするな.　You should know better at your age.
・そんなばかなことがあるものか.　That can't be (true)! ｜ Impossible!
・そんなばかな話はない.　Nothing could be more absurd.
・ばかな話もあったものだ.　This piece of stupidity really beats me.
►上にばかがつくくらいのまじめな男　a man who is ┏serious to a fault [too serious].
►ばかを言う　talk ┏nonsense [rubbish, rot]

►ばかな!　Pooh! ｜ Humbug! ｜ Bah! ｜ Pshaw!
・ばか言え!　Nonsense! ｜ Stuff and nonsense! ｜ Go on! ｜ *《俗》 Nuts!

ばかに　〔非常に〕 awfully; terribly; horribly; famously; phenomenally; frightfully; fearfully; devilish(ly); thundering; extremely; exceedingly; 〔法外に〕 ridiculously; unreasonably; absurdly; unduly; abnormally.
►ばかに寒い　be awfully cold

►ばかにして言う　say jeeringly; say in ┏derision [scorn] 《of…》
・人をばかにした言葉　scornful language
・人をばかにしたようなことを言う　speak insultingly of sb
・人を小ばかにする　make fun of sb
・彼は兄をばかにしきっている.　He's always ready to make his elder brother appear like a fool.
・初めは小学生の算数とばかにしていたが, なかなかむずかしい問題だった.　At the beginning I thought it was a math problem simple enough for an elementary school pupil, but it turned out to be quite difficult.
・子供だからといってばかにしてはならない.　Even children may have something to teach us.
・ばかにすると大変なことになるよ.　It's nothing to ┏fool around with [take lightly].

ばかにできない, ばかにならない　〔侮れない〕 not negligible; not to be taken lightly.
►風邪だって決してばかにできない.　Even a common cold should not be taken lightly.
・交通費だって決してばかにできない.　Transportation expenses are nothing to sniff at.
・夫が単身赴任だから月々の電話代もばかにならない.　My husband is posted apart from our family, so monthly phone bills are far from insignificant.
ばかになる　1 〔ばかを装う〕 posing as a fool.
►たまにはばかになって大いにはめを外すのもいいもんだ.　Occasionally it's good to throw off one's fetters and let oneself be silly.
・ここはばかになって耐えるしかない.　Now's a time to just hunker down and let whatever happens.
2 〔その機能・感覚を失う〕
►(足などがしびれて)ばかになる　be [become, go] numb 《with cold》; be benumbed; be [fall] asleep; lose 《its》 sensibility

►ばか遊びをやる　indulge in riotous pleasures; go on the spree.
ばか当たり　⇒ばかあたり.
ばか受け　great ┏popularity [success]; a great hit. [⇒おおうけ].
ばか売れ　⇒ばかうれ.
ばか踊り　a farcical dance.
ばか食い　binge eating.
►ばか食いする　binge; binge eat.
ばか景気　a boom 《in the market》.
►ばか景気がつく　boom.
ばか騒ぎ　⇒ばかさわぎ.
ばか正直　⇒ばかしょうじき.
ばか高い　ridiculously ┏high (in price) [expensive].
►ばか高い値　a fabulous [an exorbitant] price.
ばかたれ　＝ばかもの.
ばかつき　⇒ばかつき.

-ばかり [ローマ字](-bakari)
1 〔範囲の限定〕 (…だけ) only; simply; mere; alone; (もっぱら…する一方) go [keep] on doing; continue 《to do》.
►そればかりでなく　moreover; besides; in addition; on top of that; into the bargain; to boot
・…ばかりでなく　not only…but (also); as well as…

►その画家は肖像画ばかり描いていた.　The artist confined himself to painting portraits.
・これができるのはあの人ばかりだ.　He alone can do this.
・僕ばかりが損をしている.　I'm the only one who loses out.
・私ばかりがこんな考えを持っているのではない.　I am not alone in this opinion.
・あの人は毎日読書ばかりをしている.　All he does all day is read.
・彼は会社に来ても新聞を読んでいるばかりだ.　Even though he comes to the office, all he does is read the paper.
・金もうけばかりが人生の目的ではない.　Making money is not the sole goal of human existence.
・金ばかりの問題じゃないんだ.　It's not merely a question of money.
・そればかりじゃないんだ.　That's not all.
・才能ばかりでは成功できない.　One cannot succeed with talent alone.
・あそこばかりが本屋じゃない, 他の店で探してみよう.　That's not the only bookshop, so let's look at another store.
・正直な人ばかりはいない.　Not every person is honest.
・その時ばかりは驚いたね.　I was as surprised then as I had ever been.
・この時ばかりは彼が憎らしかった.　On that particular occasion, I found him despicable.
・何でもあげるがこの絵ばかりはあげられない.　I will give you anything, except (for) this picture.
・こればかりは我慢ができない.　This is the one thing I can't stand.
・うちの子は遊んでばかりいる.　My child is always ┏playing [idle]. ｜ My child does nothing but play.
・彼女はただ泣くばかりだった.　She did nothing but cry.
・あの男は飲んでばかりいる.　He is given to drinking.
・彼は親に心配ばかりかけている.　He is a constant source of anxiety to his parents.
・働いてばかりいて遊ばないとばかになる.　All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy. 【諺】
・物価は上がるばかりだ.　Prices go nowhere but up. ｜ Prices keep on rising.
・我々は彼の命令に従うばかりだった.　We had no ┏alternative [choice] but to obey his order.
・あとは寝るばかりだ.　The only thing left to do is go to bed.
・上の子ばかりか下の子まで咳をし出した.　Not only my older child, but the younger one too has developed a cough.
・うそばっかり!　You're kidding!
2 〔およそ〕 about; *around; something like; …or so; …or thereabouts; a matter of….
►30 年ばかり前　some [about] thirty years ago
・1 週間ばかり　a week or so
・1 万円ばかり　something like [in the neighborhood of] 10,000 yen
・50 歳ばかりの男　a man somewhere around fifty
・3,000 円ばかりで買う　buy sth for about 3,000 yen
・こればかりの金　such a ┏paltry sum [small amount of money]
・こればかりのこと[もの]　such a trifle; a mere trifle.
3 〔(「ばかりに」の形で)それだけの原因で, …ために〕
►…であるばかりに　only [simply] because…; simply on account of…
・会いたいばかりにはるばるやって来る　come all this way simply to see sb.
►キジはその時鳴いたばかりに見つかって撃たれてしまった.　All because the pheasant cried, it was seen and shot.
4 〔ほとんど同然なさま〕 almost; nearly; all but; as good as; 〔今にも…しそう〕 《be》 about to do; 《be》 going to do; ready 《to do》; 《be》 on the point of doing.
►ただ生きているというばかり　be all but dead; be as good as dead; be practically dead
・…と言わんばかりに　as much as to say that…; as if ┏to say [saying]…
・彼は「お前のことは生涯許さない」と言わんばかりの表情で僕をにらんだ.　He glared at me with an expression that as much as said he would not forgive me for the rest of his life.
►どうやら借金せずにいるばかりさ.　It is ┏all [as much as] I can do to keep out of debt.
・悲しみで胸が張り裂けるばかりだった.　My heart almost burst with grief.
・彼は驚いて腰を抜かさんばかりだった.　He was virtually paralyzed with fright.
・2 人は殴り合いをせんばかりだった.　They were on the point of coming to blows.
・彼女は泣かんばかりに訴えた.　She pleaded on the verge of tears.
・増水した川の濁流で橋は流されんばかりだった.　Due to the rising muddy waters of the river, the bridge was on the point of being washed away.
・ご飯は食べるばかりになっている.　The meal is ready to eat.
・夏休みの宿題は提出するばかりにしておいて, それからゆっくり遊ぼう.　Let's get the summer vacation homework ready to hand in and then enjoy ourselves.
5 〔…して間もない〕 just; only [but] just; just now; only.
►口をあけたばかりのブランデー　a freshly opened bottle of brandy
・建てたばかりの家　a newly-built house.
►今来たばかりだ.　I (have) just arrived.
・今朝着いたばかりです.　I arrived here only this morning.
・彼は大学を出たばかりだ.　He's fresh out of college.
・夜が明けたばかりだ.　It's barely sunrise.
6 〔まるでそう言うように; 強調〕
►恩返しはこの時とばかり　seeing in it an opportunity to show one's gratitude
・ここぞとばかりに力をこめた.　Deciding that now was the time, he put his strength into it.
・私が菓子の袋を開けると, 姉は待ってましたとばかり手を出してきた.　As if she's been waiting, as soon as I opened the bag of cookies, my sister came with hand stuck out.

・びっくりさせるなよ, もう.　Don't scare me like that! ｜ You're going to give me heart failure!

・けがをしたことよりびっくりしたことのほうが大きかった.　He was more frightened than hurt.

・無事に逃げる　escape ┏unhurt [unharmed, in one piece]; make good one's escape

・無事に済む　go off without incident

・これでは無事におさまるまい.　That won't settle matters at all.

・材料の余った分は次回のためにとっておきましょう.　Let's set aside the ingredients which were left over, to use (the) next time.

3 〔身分・分限〕 one's lot; one's status; one's place; one's social ┏station [position, standing]; 〔本分〕 one's duty; one's part.
►分に過ぎた　undue; undeserved; 〔暮らしなど〕 above one's means

►分を守る　keep to one's sphere in life
・分をわきまえる　know one's ┏place [station]
・分をわきまえさせる　put sb in his place

4 〔程度〕 a rate; a degree; 〔調子〕 a condition; a state (of affairs).
►この分では　⇒このぶん
・あの分では財産はすぐなくなってしまうだろう.　At that rate his fortune will not last long.

・その作業は見ている分には簡単そうだ.　From what I can see of that ┏work [operation], it looks easy.

►あの分だと 1 位になるだろう.　She seems to be in such good shape that I expect she'll win first place.

►若いうち苦労した分, 今楽していられる.　In my youth I worked hard, so now I can ┏relax [take it easy, live in comfort].
・このキュウリは形が不揃いだけど, その分お安くしておくよ.　These cucumbers are not all the same ┏shape [size], so I'll give you a discount.
・今年のリンゴは, 雨が少なかった分実は小さいけれど甘さは抜群だ.　Apples this year are smaller than usual, since there was less rain, but ┏the sweetness is outstanding [they are very sweet].
